Package algorithms

Class DWGraph_AlgoGW

java.lang.Object
algorithms.DWGraph_AlgoGW
All Implemented Interfaces:
dw_graph_algorithms
public class DWGraph_AlgoGW
extends java.lang.Object
implements dw_graph_algorithms
This class knows how to do operations on graphs. We can check if the graph is Strongly Connected, check the cheap path between two nodes and the cheap distance between two nodes. We can save the graph on json file and load the graph from json file. This class uses a DFS algorithm that allows running on all nodes in the graph and do transpoz to the graph edge in run time O(n+m). This class uses a Dijkstra algorithm that allows running on all nodes in the graph and find the cheap path two nodes in run time O(E*log(V)). https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tarjan%27s_strongly_connected_components_algorithm. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dijkstra%27s_algorithm.
Author:
George kouzy and Dolev Saadia. *

    • isConnected

      public boolean isConnected()
      This function checks if there is a Path from each node to all the nodes With Dfs Algorithm- this is an improved DFS called Tarjan Algorithm. after DFS Algorithm we checking the number of connected graphs(_count_connected_graphs) if _count_connected_graphs equal to 1 So the graph is strongly connected and can be reached from any node to any other node. we use inner class Tarjan_Algo- serves data Structure: stack ,lowlink ,count and _count_connected_graphs. run time O(E + V): E- the number of ribs, V- the number of nodes.
      Specified by:
      isConnected in interface dw_graph_algorithms
      Returns:
      -True if and only if (iff) there is a valid path from each node to each else return false

    • shortestPathDist

      public double shortestPathDist​(int src, int dest)
      returns the length of the shortest path between src to dest if src==dest we return 0 or if no path between the node return -1. In order to find the shortest distance from source node to destination node we will use the algorithm of dijkstra.
      Specified by:
      shortestPathDist in interface dw_graph_algorithms

    • save

      public boolean save​(java.lang.String file)
      Saves this directed weighted graph to this json file name(String file). This function path of json file name on the computer. The default path to this file is in the project folder. we use inner class call serialize- Which allows us to extract the information we need and write it into the json file. The information we want to keep is: array of all edges and array of all nodes. run time: O(E*V)- E - edges and V-nodes. we use gson jar to get json file saved. if the save successfully The default path to this file is in the project folder.
      Specified by:
      save in interface dw_graph_algorithms
      Parameters:
      String - file - The file name.
      Returns:
      - if the file was successfully saved return true else false

    • load

      public boolean load​(java.lang.String file)
      Load this json file (directed weighted graph). This function path of json file name on the computer. The default path to this file is in the project folder. we use inner class call deserialize- Which allows us to extract the information from the json file that we need and read it and create a new graph . and its data can be used to recreate the object in memory. The information we want to load is: array of all edges and array of all nodes. run time: O(E*V)- E - edges and V-nodes. we use gson jar to get json file load.
      Specified by:
      load in interface dw_graph_algorithms
      Parameters:
      String - file - The file name.
      Returns:
      - if the file was successfully load return true else false
